column4: hi, how to create the home folder without reinstalling??  have a /home partition specifically for this
you know the root password?
just installed 12.04 and set the home folder in a separate partition i had previously
accidentally, deleted the home folder with my username, the partition is still there but the folder is gone
create a new user
haz31nut: i know the password, and the file system is intact, just doesn't log in because it lacks a home folder. have to login as guest
at the grub menu boot the recovery console
useradd iwface
then reboot. you should get the iwface user in the login screen
tried to copy the home folder from a guest session, which is stored in /tmp, into the separate partition, but it doesnt work as it lacks the configuration files with my username
so i guess reinstalling is the best shot??
I just told you how to do it.
at the grub menu boot the recovery console
useradd iwface
then reboot. you should get the iwface user in the login screen
haznut: the system boots to the login screen, my username is there, hit the passwd and then comes back to the login screen
you don;t get a grub menu with option to select recover or do a memtest?
haz31nut: yes but the issue is not at the grub menu
I know. I'm telling yo how to create a new user, which will crate a new home folder.
haz31nut: by booting the recovery console? will it ask me to create a new user?
haz31nut: never used the recovery console, so dont know what it does
no, it will ask for root password. then drop you to shell prompt where you will type "useradd iwface"  without quotes or whatever username you want.
haz31nut: that seems a proper workaround!
good luck
